is.hello.buruberi.bluetooth.stacks.util

Class PeripheralCriteria

  • java.lang.Object
    • is.hello.buruberi.bluetooth.stacks.util.PeripheralCriteria

  • public final class PeripheralCriteria
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes what a BluetoothStack should look for when performing discovery. Provides simple device address matching, maximum match count and duration constraints, and a free-form system for matching against advertising data scanned from peripherals.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_DURATION_MS
      The default timeout duration.
      long duration
      The maximum amount of time that can pass before the scan is ended.
      int limit
      The maximum number of peripherals to scan before stopping.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> peripheralAddresses
      Device addresses to match against.
      java.util.List<rx.functions.Func1<AdvertisingData,java.lang.Boolean>> predicates
      A list of predicate functions that will be called to determine whether or not a collection of advertising data matches this criteria object.
      boolean wantsHighPowerPreScan
      Whether or not to perform a high power scan before performing a low energy scan.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_DURATION_MS

        public static final int DEFAULT_DURATION_MS
        The default timeout duration. 10 seconds.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • peripheralAddresses

        public final java.util.Set<java.lang.String> peripheralAddresses
        Device addresses to match against.

        This list being empty has the effect of all addresses being acceptable.

      • predicates

        public final java.util.List<rx.functions.Func1<AdvertisingData,java.lang.Boolean>> predicates
        A list of predicate functions that will be called to determine whether or not a collection of advertising data matches this criteria object. All predicates must evaluate to true for the criteria to match a potential peripheral.

      • limit

        public int limit
        The maximum number of peripherals to scan before stopping.

      • duration

        public long duration
        The maximum amount of time that can pass before the scan is ended.

      • wantsHighPowerPreScan

        public boolean wantsHighPowerPreScan
        Whether or not to perform a high power scan before performing a low energy scan. Required for some devices to be able to detect advertising data.
        See Also:
        DeviceSupport.isHighPowerPreScanNeeded()

    • Constructor Detail

      • PeripheralCriteria

        public PeripheralCriteria()

    • Method Detail

      • forAddress

        public static PeripheralCriteria forAddress(java.lang.String address)
        Returns a configured criteria that will search for one instance of a given address.

      • addPeripheralAddress

        public PeripheralCriteria addPeripheralAddress(java.lang.String address)
        Adds a peripheral address to match against when scanning.

        The first address changes the scanning behavior from matching any address, to just matching the address added.

      • addPredicate

        public PeripheralCriteria addPredicate(rx.functions.Func1<AdvertisingData,java.lang.Boolean> predicate)
        Adds a predicate functor to invoke when determining if the criteria matches a given advertising data collection. All predicates must return true for the criteria to be considered satisfied.

      • addExactMatchPredicate

        public PeripheralCriteria addExactMatchPredicate(int type,
                                                 byte[] toMatch)
        Adds a predicate to check that an advertising data record exactly matches a given byte payload.

      • addExactMatchPredicate

        public PeripheralCriteria addExactMatchPredicate(int type,
                                                 java.lang.String toMatch)
        Convenience method for using addExactMatchPredicate(int, byte[]) with a String.

      • addStartsWithPredicate

        public PeripheralCriteria addStartsWithPredicate(int type,
                                                 byte[] prefix)
        Adds a predicate to check that an advertising data record starts with a given byte payload.

      • addStartsWithPredicate

        public PeripheralCriteria addStartsWithPredicate(int type,
                                                 java.lang.String prefix)
        Convenience method for using addStartsWithPredicate(int, byte[]) with a String.

      • setLimit

        public PeripheralCriteria setLimit(int limit)
        Sets the maximum number of peripherals to scan for before stopping. Defaults to unbounded.

      • setDuration

        public PeripheralCriteria setDuration(long duration)
        Sets the maximum duration of the scan.
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_DURATION_MS

      • setWantsHighPowerPreScan

        public PeripheralCriteria setWantsHighPowerPreScan(boolean wantsHighPowerPreScan)
        Sets whether or not to perform a high power scan before performing a lower power discovery.

        A high power scan is required by some phones to properly detect BLE advertising data. However, high power scans are both slow and power intensive, so they should not be used without the user requesting it.

        See Also:
        DeviceSupport.isHighPowerPreScanNeeded()

      • matches

        public boolean matches(AdvertisingData scanResponses)
        Used by bluetooth stack implementations. Returns whether or not the criteria is satisfied by a given advertising data collection.
